techniques.name: Neutron diffraction
techniques.parameters: HB4 high-resolution powder diffractometer, 1.4180 Å wavelength

challenge.description: The lattice parameter of Li4Mn5O12 was found to be sensitive to synthesis temperature due to variations in manganese valence.
challenge.impact: This sensitivity affects the stoichiometry and structural integrity of the material, which is critical for its performance as a cathode material.

solution.description: Controlled synthesis conditions were employed, including slow heating and cooling under flowing oxygen to stabilize the manganese valence and achieve the desired stoichiometry.
solution.methodology: Heating at specific temperatures (e.g., 700°C) with controlled oxygen flow (200 ml/min) and slow cooling in the furnace.
solution.effectiveness: The approach successfully produced well-crystallized Li4Mn5O12 with consistent structural parameters, though minor deviations in manganese oxidation state were still observed.

evidence.source: Sections discussing synthesis and structural refinement (e.g., Experimental and Results sections, Figures 3 and 4).
evidence.data: Refined lattice parameters and manganese site occupancy factors showed good agreement with ideal values, indicating effective stabilization of the structure.

context.material_properties: Li4Mn5O12 is a cubic spinel with lithium ions occupying tetrahedral and octahedral sites, and manganese ions primarily in octahedral sites.
context.experimental_conditions: Synthesis temperatures ranged from 400°C to 900°C under flowing oxygen, with slow heating and cooling rates.
context.application_relevance: The material is intended for use as a cathode in rechargeable lithium batteries, where structural stability and stoichiometry are critical for performance.

challenge.description: Determining the distribution of lithium ions was difficult due to their weak X-ray scattering properties.
challenge.impact: Accurate determination of lithium ion distribution is essential for understanding the material's electrochemical performance and structural stability.

solution.description: Neutron diffraction was used alongside X-ray diffraction to refine structural parameters and confirm lithium ion distribution.
solution.methodology: Simultaneous Rietveld refinement of X-ray and neutron diffraction data, with constraints applied to improve consistency.
solution.effectiveness: The combined approach provided more quantitative structural information, though combined refinement using Rietveld software was not possible.

evidence.source: Sections discussing structural refinement (e.g., Results section, Figure 1).
evidence.data: Refined site occupancies and thermal parameters confirmed lithium ion distribution close to the ideal arrangement.

context.material_properties: Li4Mn5O12 has lithium ions distributed across tetrahedral and octahedral sites, which influences its electrochemical behavior.
context.experimental_conditions: Characterization involved X-ray and neutron diffraction at room temperature, with refinement using Rietveld methods.
context.application_relevance: Understanding lithium ion distribution is crucial for optimizing the material's performance in lithium-ion batteries.

challenge.description: Structural changes caused by Jahn-Teller distortion upon deep discharging could degrade cycling performance.
challenge.impact: Jahn-Teller distortion leads to structural instability, reducing the material's effectiveness as a cathode in rechargeable batteries.

solution.description: Introducing a small amount of lithium ions into the 16d sites to maintain the average manganese oxidation state slightly above 3.5.
solution.methodology: Chemical modification of the material's composition during synthesis to suppress Jahn-Teller distortion.
solution.effectiveness: The approach successfully suppressed the onset of structural changes, improving cycling performance.

evidence.source: Introduction section, references to previous studies (e.g., citations 2 and 11).
evidence.data: Improved cycling performance observed in modified spinel compositions with suppressed Jahn-Teller distortion.

context.material_properties: Li4Mn5O12 exhibits high cell voltage and good rechargeability, but is prone to structural changes under deep discharge.
context.experimental_conditions: Modification of lithium ion distribution during synthesis to stabilize manganese oxidation state.
context.application_relevance: Enhanced cycling performance is critical for the material's use in advanced lithium-ion batteries.
